text.content:
Patient arrived on the unit.  See admission assessment note.

NURSING NOTE 
    1500 - 2330

    Has there been a FALL in the past 48 hours? 
         No
PATIENT EDUCATION
   BARRIERS TO LEARNING
   Patient:  No observed barriers to learning 
   Comments: 
   Family/Significant Other: 
   Comments: 
   Information Taught:  Orientation to unit, call light use, 
telephone, TV and the location of the 
Bathroom

   To Whom: Patient
 
   Method:  verbal, handout, demonstration 
 
   Learner Response:  Indicates Understanding 
 
   Comments: 
MORSE FALL SCALE
 
   History of Falls   0 No
   Secondary Dx      15 Yes
   Ambulatory Aid     0 None/ Bedrest/ Nurse assist
   IV/Hep Lock       20 Yes
   Gait/Transfer      0 Normal/BR/Wheelchair
   Mental Status      0 Oriented to own ability

   TOTAL SCORE:      35

BASIC PAIN ASSESSMENT/REASSESSMENT
   WILDCATS - all areas MUST be completed for any reports of pain
      Patient Words Describing pain or Pain Behaviors Observed:
         sharp pain in chest/abdomin
      Intensity (0 no pain 10 worst possible) 5 
      Pain behaviors mild, moderate, severe :
         moderate
      Location(s):
         Chest/Abd
      Duration:
         constatnt
      Patient's Comfort Goal  2:
 
      Aggravating/Alleviating Factors:
         increase with food. 
   no increase with activity or movement.
   some improvement with positional changes 
      Treatments (Drug and Non Drug, Past, Present, & Beliefs):
         see meds
      Symptoms and Side Effects of pain and pain treatments:
         drowsy

PROBLEM LIST AND GOALS
~~~~ 
PAIN
~~~~
      PROBLEM or Need:  PAIN (Pain scale > 4, or patient requests intervention)
Goal: Pain scale scale < 4, or patient reports acceptable pain level.
Target date: Within 72 hours of admission. 

                 Problem status:  NEW
   INTERVENTIONS
   Pain Management (NIC #1400)
   Definition: Alleviation of pain or a reduction in pain to a level of comfort
   that is acceptable to the patient.
   Pharmacologic Management
   Pain medication given as ordered. 
   Patient goal for relief not met.
     Current pain score 5.
   Assess comfort needs q 2 hours. 
   If pain continues at greater than or equal to 4, complete Basic Pain
   Assessment/Reassessment(WILDCATS).
   Control environmental factors that may influence patient's response to 
   discomfort.
 
   Reduce or eliminate factors that are barriers to pain management.
   Fear, Monotony/Boredom
   Select and implement measures for pain relief as appropriate.
     Pharmacologic: (give analgesia as ordered)
    Provide/teach information on pain management strategies
   Patient given copy of the leaflet, "Managing Your Pain": Yes
   Family member given copy of the leaflet, "Managing Your Pain": 
   Teach to monitor own pain and to request intervention before pain becomes 
   severe.
   EVALUATION:  Pain is improved, but goal not yet met.

Patient and/or Significant Other has had input and agreed to the plan of care.
IV ACCESS
   Peripheral IV 
     Size: #18
     Location: Left AC
     Date placed: July 9,2013

1500: recieved report from Charge nurse.  Patient arrived on unit.  Patient 
oriented to the unit and provided a call light.  She verbalizes that she will 
use the call light before getting up without assistance.

1544: assessment completed.  Wean to RA from 2L O2.

1623: MD at bedside.  Plan of care reviewed with the patient.  Patient is on 23 
hr Obs status and may go home tomorrow.

1710: Patient is hungry.  MD Resident notified of no diet order yet.

1800: Clears diet provided per orders.

2140: Assist patient to BR for evening ADLs.

2230: Pt resting quietly in bed

2300: report to oncoming RN
text.author: NURSE,FORTY
